content.description: Climb a relatively moderate face other than a dyno midway to steep compression climbing on crisp sidepulls with powerful/bouldery movement. According to ticks on 8a.nu, some folks find this route to be hard for the grade and comparable in difficulty to Apes.
content.location: Main Apes buttress, two routes left of Apes on Acid (13d).

content.description: Gorgeous line on beautiful stone. Climb gently overhung face to a stance at the second bolt. Cop a shake and continue through a compression sequence to a couple long moves which bring you to another stance. Move through sequential sidepulls aiming for a jug horizontal and final shake before the high crux. Boulder through striking features, using some key trickery to navigate the directional holds. Snag the ledge and send the rig!
content.protection: ~10 bolts, fixed permadraw at the high roof
content.location: Main Apes Wall, two routes right of Creature Feature. There are usually stones at the base of these routes marking their names.

content.description:
This area is currently closed due to peregrine falcon nesting. Please see the SCC web site for updates.

 This sector hosts some of Castle Rock's hardest, most classic lines including Apes on Acid (13d) and Creature Feature (13c).
